column4: Anyone know how I can get firefox on ubuntu 8.10 working with websense?
how would IE work differently with websense ?
IE and FF both work on windows. websense relies (I believe) on the active directory login status of the user on the machine.
yes, but does IE use Active Directory? you're suggesting it does.
IE can use AD. I don't think it is in this case (otherwise I Should be getting a proxy login prompt on FF)
I suspect websense actually checks if the machine the request is coming from is logged into AD>
you want to use ubuntu then to replace windows in a network that uses AD ?
no, I want to use ubuntu on a second desktop to suplement my windows machine.
And what about adding a second ethernet to the windows machine, do NAT from it and feed the connection to your linux? This is just an idea though.

I can't really do that. Long term, I'm exploring this as the possibility of deploying linux to some folks here. Websense is going to stick around though, so I need to find a broadly deployable way to do this.
I'm affraid you'd want to check the openLDAP related documentation. Which is overly complicated for my tastes.
well, I'm already logging into ubuntu using an AD account. This part works.
I'd guess you're even more than halfway there to what you want to achive.
I'd check the messages that websesnse generates for these failed attempts. I'm not familiar with websense though, just heared of it.

but I tell you one thing. In a previous job I had, they used AD and websense and all. Now, with a liveCD, I'd boot up, set the ip addresses and gateway and nameservers as they were in windows, and Iwas good to go.
I already have the right DNS and gateway :)
that means you use maybe a newer release of websense. Or maybe it was deploied otherwise in my case. idk.
